author: Robin W.
text: Wow @NorahODonnell looks absolutely stunning this evening. What a gem! @CBSEveningNews

author: Robin W.
text: I challenge @elonmusk - to give me $500,000 so I can pay off my student debt. Set up a decent college fund for my son, buy a nice little home and start my own business. Lol. Whatever change you have left over would be much appreciated. https://t.co/HJKzYCvpvd

author: Robin W.
text: Binge watched the tv show Roc on Amazon prime. The most underrated show. Black love. Unity. Family. Community Protection. Activism. Bring back the 90’s when TV meant something and had substance. @RockyCOfficial @EllaJoyce - y’all did that!

author: Robin W.
text: It’s hard enough for people to pay one fare but two because 86th street you can’t crossover ridiculous

author: Robin W.
text: The conductor made no announcement that the 6 train would be going express! @MTA - y’all have got to do better than this!

author: Robin W.
text: There has been no solution to the problem. No answer. Just unresolved. I’ve filed complaints with the @BBBKY I’ve sent emails. I’ve exhausted all of my resources and I need help. #robinhoodapp @ninapineda7 #7onyourside someone please help me!! Please!

author: Robin W.
text: I get sent an email saying my account will@be deactivated. I have money in an account that they will not allow me to transfer or access and I am at my whits end because I need and want my money. I’m sick and tired of emails. Im tired of the runaround.

author: Robin W.
text: What can we do to help? What can be done? Are things going to get worse before they get better? I’m terrified and summer hasn’t begun yet. Mental illness gang violence gun violence what will you all do? #thebronx #fordhamroad #kingsbridge #GUNviolence

author: Robin W.
text: the park or the library not even to McDonald’s. You all have got to do something. This mother grandmother that lost her life last night could’ve been me my mother my neighbor my aunt as we frequent the fish markets and vegetable stands and restaurants in that area.

author: Robin W.
text: Done with the amount of violence that’s happening in our city. We voted for you to represent and protect us and right now I don’t feel that. I don’t feel safe. I don’t feel protected. Gun violence is at an all time high especially around here. I don’t feel safe taking my son to
